highlights.description: Go framework for analyzing compliance regulations with machine-readable data structures
CLI tool for loading, querying, and validating compliance frameworks
Web viewer for browsing compliance data (GitHub Pages compatible)

added.description: Core compliance data model: Jurisdiction, Regulation, Requirement, Solution, Mapping, ZoneAssignment, EnforcementAssessment types
ComplianceFramework container with query methods for requirements, solutions, mappings, and zones
ComplianceAnalysis and ExecutiveOverview types for strategic reporting
ResearchInput processing with validation and analysis
JSON file I/O utilities for loading and saving compliance frameworks
`comply` CLI with load, list, query, validate, coverage, and import-research commands
TypeScript/Vite web viewer with executive overview dashboard
Interactive tables and modal dialogs for browsing compliance data
JSON schemas for research-input, compliance-analysis, and executive-overview
Minimal example framework with sample jurisdictions, regulations, and solutions

fixed.description: Use `fmt.Fprintf` instead of `WriteString` with `Sprintf` per staticcheck QF1012

tests.description: Unit tests for ComplianceFramework query methods
I/O tests for JSON serialization and file operations

documentation.description: README with installation, CLI usage, library API, and data model reference
MkDocs documentation site with guides for compliance officers, research assistants, developers, and data maintainers
Reference documentation for regulations, requirements, solutions, and control mapping
Added shields for CI, lint, SAST, Go Report Card, pkg.go.dev, and license
Added emoji icons to README features section

infrastructure.description: GitHub Actions workflows for CI, linting, and CodeQL SAST
Gitignore for build artifacts and IDE files
